headline: Simple Beef Pot Roast
description: This easy pot roast recipe from Chef John is hearty and satisfying. The soft vegetables combine with the meat's juices to create a delicious sauce!

video.description: Simple Beef Pot Roast Recipe - Basic Beef Chuck Roast
video.name: Simple Beef Pot Roast

name: Simple Beef Pot Roast

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat the oven to 275 degrees F (135 degrees C).
Heat vegetable oil into a large oven-safe pot over medium-high heat. Season chuck roast with salt and black pepper, then cook in hot oil until brown on both sides; transfer to a plate.

Add carrots, celery, and onion into the pot. Cook and stir until vegetables start to release their juices, scraping any brown flavor bits off the bottom of the pot, about 3 minutes. Add butter, and cook until onions are translucent, about 5 minutes. Sprinkle in rosemary; return roast to the pot and cover.
Roast in the preheated oven until the chuck roast is tender, about 2 1/2 to 3 hours. Season vegetables with additional salt and black pepper, if desired.

review.reviewBody: I’ve made this twice! Use braising pan. Used fresh rosemary sprigs instead of dried. Added 1 cup potatoes. It is fabulous, meat is soft, o knife needed!!! and melt in your mouth. Wonderful au jus. Easy to prep. Chef John has great recipes.
Absolutely the best pot roast I’ve ever had. Omitted rosemary & threw some potatoes, carrots & onions on top. Delicious!

I've made this 3 times and I follow the directions. It's tender, juicy and delicious. If you are tempted to add liquid, sit on your hands! Check the tenderness at about 2.5 hours, when it's fork tender it's done. You can always add more liquid to your gravy while the roast rests. The only variants I make are to add garlic to the chopped veggies and carrot wedges around the roast for the last 30 minutes. Served over mashers. Yum.
I doubled the vegetables and followed all other directions. The meat was so tender and the vegetable hash was a perfect accompaniment. It’s my new chuck roast recipe.
I followed the recipe as it is written and didn't changed a thing. The roast turned out great!

I've made this at least 6 times and it's brilliant as-is. Here are a few changes that I really enjoy. First, add 1/2 tsp of ground sage to the seasoning. Second, and this has been a BIG hit, double or triple the amount of vegetables then after the roast is done use 1/2 or 1/3 of the vegetables to make a puree for topping the roast and/or vegetables. Remove 1/2 to 1/3 of the vegetables plus 1 Tbsp of the juice from the pan and place it in a blender. Puree on high and add small amounts of beef broth to get the consistency you desire (thick, but pourable). Place it in a gravy boat next to the roast and veggies when serving, it's fantastic!
Absolutely Perfect! The only change I made was I omitted the rosemary and added 4 crushed garlic cloves. I cooked a 3.5 lb roast for 2 hours and 15 mins. Delicious!
Perfect results, delicious and easy. My only wish is that there were more veggies. I might try 1.5 cups each next time, a bit more butter and hope there’s enough beef juice.

This recipe reminded me of my Aunt growing up making roast in the the oven on Sundays after church. It was a prefect roast for a lovely fall football Sunday. I added 1/4 cup red wine, mushrooms, and garlic cloves. Warmed a few dinner rolls to have with. Now I'm thinking how can I make a pot roast pot pie with the leftovers. You can't go wrong with this recipe.

This is “The Bomb of Beef Roast Recipes!” Followed the recipe to the tee!! The second time I made it I added mushrooms and garlic, just for our taste!! Absolutely Great for a Sunday Dinner! Easy and makes the whole house smell so good… Especially if you love watching Football on a Sunday afternoon!! Do all the prep before the game, toss in the oven and enjoy your afternoon! DEFINITELY a must try recipe

wow - so simple and so tasty. I added a little garlic and red pepper and bay leaves, but otherwise followed the recipe. the meat melted in our mouths. It was very delicious, tender and the perfect comfort food. Brought back memories of home long ago. My husband says it is the best he's ever had. I used my heavy dutch oven and it kept in all the moisture and the cooked veggies were wonderful. this is a keeper No photo since we devoured it!

Such a simple but delicious recipe! Served over Chef John’s perfect mashed potatoes and my family couldn’t get enough. Followed everything exactly but have yet to find chuck roast as pretty as the one in his video, doesn’t make it any less tasty. Will def be making again

My first pot roast-and it was awesome! I used a zucchini instead of celery, added some thyme and a fresh sprig of rosemary. Came out tender and I was surprised to find that the juices of the veggies made plenty of liquid to pour over dinner and the remaining meat. Followed the directions and it was perfect. Took 2:45 in oven to cook 3.85 lb chuck roast.

Fantastic! I made this a crock pot dinner. Just put the veggies down first in the crock pot, added baby red potatoes, then put in the roast, omitted the butter and oil, and put a packet of lipton onion soup on top of the roast. Cooked on high for 5.5 hours. PERFECT!!!! DELICIOUS YUMMINESS!

This is my go-to pot roast recipe. My family, including the kids, loves it. I follow the recipe as written with no adjustments. I find the dish to be flavorful with plenty of liquid. It requires little prep and the oven does most of the heavy lifting. So easy to get this going early in the afternoon to be ready just in time for Sunday dinner.
Tasty.
Delicious. Not as good s mama's. But delicious.

My crew loved this meal! My roast was slightly smaller and I increased the veggies. (There can always be more veggies!) I added a small amount of garlic to the veggies before roasting, but the taste was negligible. I served the pot roast over regular mashed potatoes. It was awesome!!!
Absolutely delicious!!! My favorite way to have pot roast. Made just as written.

This slow roast is great for less expensive cuts of meat. Yes, it will be well done, but it will be fall apart done, if you know what I mean. We like our veggies chunkier, so that's the way we do it. Threw in some baby spuds. Easy Sunday dinner.

I used a McCormick Spice blend called Herbes de Provence whose first ingredient is Rosemary, but also includes Marjoram, Thyme, Savory, Sage. I've had great experiences with this blend in the past... The roast is still in the oven, but smells good. ;-)
This was good and would make again, needs more flavor. I added a can of beef broth when I put in oven. Made a gravy with broth and poured over meat when serving.
Wonderful.
Absolutely perfect

Super easy and delicious!
I substituted savory (a favorite herb blend) seasoning for the rosemary.
I seared the meat and sautéed the vegetables in my Lodge cast iron skillet, but then it wouldn't fit in my oven (oh well).
If there is anything leftover, I put it in beef broth with a can of petite cut tomatoes.
It was great, we followed the recipe to a T.
amazing taste and simple to make. I'll make this one again
I used to make roasts in my slow cooker or Instpot. I discovered this recipe a couple of years ago and I will never make it any other way. Easy and perfectly cooked every single time. I love it.

It worked out beautifully! I was in a rush and did not cook the celery or carrots. I just laid the seared beef on top of them and they cooked perfectly, but not so much to be soggy. The beef fell apart after 3 hours at this low temp. I allowed it to rest while I watered the garden and dinner was a success. Thanks Chef John!

Really good! Added a scant 1/4 cup red wine while sautéing the veggies, and 2 cloves of garlic on top of the roast. At 2.5 hours it wasn’t done, so I cranked the heat to 400 (b/c I needed that temp for the rolls) and by 3 hours it was perfect. (I had a 2.9 lb chuck roast). Veggies were very good too, I expected all mush but they had some bite left. Perfect over mashed potatoes. First time not braising a pot roast and I think this will be my go to recipe now.
I followed the recipe as shown and it turned out great. I would definitely make it again.
Another Chef John simple masterpiece! I use his recipe and make this delicious roast and vegetables every 2 weeks, consistently. It's fantastic! Thanks so much Chef J!! :)

I only gave 3 stars because there really needs to be instructions for cooking it in a covered pan rather than a Dutch oven. This was a good recipe flavor wise however beware of what you cook this in! I cooked mine in a large metal buffet pan covered in foil. My roast was 4.3 lbs. 3 hours in my roast was still extremely tough. I had to bump the oven to 350. If you are not using a Dutch oven you’ll definitely need to cook it at a higher temperature!
Delicious as is, family lives it and I will make it again soon, thank you
I usually make pot roast in the slow cooker but this was awesome. The vegetables had tons of flavor so be sure to serve them up.

I made this for dinner last night and it was oh, so good !
In fact, there was a small bit of leftovers which I will have for lunch today.
(A pot roast sandwich sounds delish)
Thank you for another fantastic recipe.

Next time I’ll cut back a little on the salt but besides that I love it. I even take about 3 Tablespoons of the au jus and add some beef broth to it it along with cornstarch to make a more “traditional” gravy that my husband prefers. I load the veggies on top of my mashed potatoes and I’m good to go!
I made almost exactly like the recipe was written, except I put in beef broth. Thank you
Man this good! I like extra vegetable And I don’t dice them, I like them chopped larger as they taste like Heaven! My house smells amazing!
This is the easiest and best pot roast recipe. I did not use all the butter, but other than that, followed the recipe. It’s my go to.

Delicious, very tender beef. Appreciated the mushy veggie “gravy” but added chunks of Yukon gold potatoes & carrots for the last 40 minutes for our sides. Skeptical of no added liquid, but it was perfect. My chuck roast had some fat in the middle, so hard to trim off. Think that made my dish excessively fatty & I should have probably omitted the butter.
Fantastic!! I have always used the crock pot to cook pot roast but we will not go back. Love the vegetable and I am not usually fond of cooked carrots.
I followed the instruction with no changes. Very easy to prepare, then just let it roast for 3 hours. My family loved it!

Amazing. I did marinade the roast for a couple hours in the recipe on here "best steak marinade". Then followed the recipe, I did use colorful carrots and colorful onions, cooked for 2.5 hrs. The family really enjoyed it.

Here is an example of how a five star recipe gets wrongfully down graded because some people make uninformed assumptions. Pot roast is cooked to well-done this makes the meat very tender which is what you are striving for. The tenderness and seasoning is where you get the flavor IE. garlic, onion, bay, rosemary and the vegetables. Anything less than fully cooked is roast beef. I love both, but for different reasons. Pot roast is awesome wish I had some now. Great recipe.

I can't figure out what I did wrong, I followed the recipe exactly. The meat was okay but was overcooked and tough and definitely nothing like melt in your mouth despite swimming in an inch thick of grease that came out during cooking. I intended to use the leftovers for roast beef sandwiches tonight but I can't see how it will be good since it is dry/tough. The veggies did mush together and surprisingly my teenager really loved them. Probably because they flavored up while swimming in the 1 inch thick grease at the bottom that came off the meat during cooking. Definitely no liquid was needed! We still ate it but I was really disappointed based on good reviews, expecting it to be wonderful and melting in my mouth like pot roast should be. It just seemed like I overcooked the roast (4 lb that I cooked exactly 3 hours 10 mins). I'd like to try again based on the good veggies but I don't know what I did wrong to correct next time.

This is delicious, thank you for such a simple, wonderful recipe! I used Montreal Seasoning and a couple garlic cloves on the meat like another reviewer suggested. I also cut WAY back on the butter since my roast had some fat on it. Was a bit skeptical but the vegetables were as delicious as the meat!

I had a 5 pound roast and wanted it cooked in the same time frame so I upped the temp to 300. I used 1 tbsp fresh rosemary and put salt and pepper in each layer to build flavor. This was amazing!!! Will make again for sure!!

I made this recipe exactly how it was written and followed the video. It turned out great! I apparently didn’t season enough because it needed more salt and pepper but loved pouring the sauce with veggies over the meat and served it on top of mashed potatoes just like the video. Yummy! Will definitely make again!

Best pot roast ever. I followed the recipe exactly. I’ve always made roast in the slow cooker because that’s all I’ve ever known. I discovered Chef John a couple of years ago and have gradually been expanding my knowledge and skills ever since. I had a roast on hand and wanted to use it up so I searched specifically for a Chef John recipe. He did not disappoint. My husband raved all night. Tender, juicy, and simple but satisfying flavor. I’ll never make roast any other way again.
Followed the recipe to a T! Awesome! Used grass-feed, grass-finished beef and organic veggies! Great flavor! Fantastic!
Wow! First decent pot roast I’ve ever made! ..Falls apart with a fork.
Very flavorful roast. I used eye round, substituted olive oil for butter and added thyme and sage because I was out of rosemary. A big hit at the dinner table!

Easy prep, Tender beef, good flavor, using cast iron pot with lid. 
I added garlic powder to the beef after browning, and increased cooking to 3 1/2 hours at 300 deg F. Next time will divide a packet of onion soup mix under & over the roast before cooking, for added flavor. 
I discarded the overcooked vegetables, straining the liquid to a skillet for making gravy. 
Those reviewers who complain that the meat is over-cooked should learn the difference between roast beef and beef pot roast.
recipe was easy to follow. Good deal!

Best pot roast ever! I’ve been making pot roast for years and it’s always been good, but somewhat bland. This pot roast was flavorful and super tender. And the gravy I made from the drippings was amazing! I pretty much stuck to the recipe. The only variation I made was the addition of two minced garlic cloves. My husband loved it. I will be making this again and again.
This recipe is amazing. I cannot get enough of it. Turns out amazing every single time.

One word - DEELISH! Made it exactly as stated (adjusting for roast size), and it couldn't have turned out better. This is definitely a keeper that I will be using again and again! Thanks Chef John!
I serve it over potatoes and parsnips mashed together, with minced fresh rosemary stirred in.

I was really hopeful due to all the positive reviews maybe I’m just a Southern girl that’s used to momma pot roast that falls apart and tastes like a heart attack lol. Very very disappointed in this recipe. I added garlic and potatoes as many people suggested but it didn’t save the dish- once it cooled down I added a cup of water, Dried Italian dressing In the packet , onion soup mix and A buttermilk Ranch packet- Anything for flavor. I cooked it another hour and then strained the veggies And roast out- took the gravy and put it on the stove- Added flour and made a gravy. I made mashed potatoes. Together everything went well but it took so much work.
Awesome! Added mushrooms and served with mashed potatoes.
added a little fennel seed. great roast. needs more vegetables

I made this for my extended family and everyone loved it! I actually cooked it in my mother’s old electric skillet, so I had to add a little water as it was cooking. It was fork tender and the flavor was wonderful! My sister-in-law said it was better than pot roast that they had in a restaurant that they waited in line two hours for!
My family loves this dish. Every time I make this, it turns out tender, moist, and well-seasoned. It is so simple to make. I also add garlic to the recipe. I will make this one again and again.

Update following final product. To be fair any recipe is a base start for your specific tastes in food. That being said, I had to highly alter this recipe to make it satisfactory. Cooking time went into 5 hours and so much added to even have a flavor. I suppose thats what cooking is all about!

Best pot roast recipe I've ever had! The meat is fall apart melt in your mouth good! I added garlic and used ghee instead of butter but those were just a matter of preference and diet. I have recommended this recipe to several people.
Delicious and easy to make. I cooked in an iron skillet. Used foil as a lid since i didnt have an oven safe lid. Veggies do create a wonderful flavoring. With the juice from the roast.

This is so simple and delicious. Comes out tender and shreds like a good pot roast should. The vegetables come out great. If you are not a big a fan of rosemary you can leave it out and it is still great. My family and friends request this from me. Try it it’s worth it!

YUM!! This was the best pot roast I've ever made. Don't worry about not having water in this, it has enough fat to leave tender and juicy. I added a spash of red wine - pinot noir 1/4 cup and a couple of diced mushrooms based on other reviews. I think it would be absolutely fine without these as written.

I cant believe how amazing this was! My daughter, who always finds issues with her food, inhaled it. They ate second. There are no leftovers! I will DEFINITELY be making this again, as requested by the whole gang!! Added mashed potatoes and a nice salad.
This is super flavorful and tender. My only addition was to add 1 cup of sliced mushrooms. This is now my go to pot roast. I will never add liquid again. Thank you Chef John for another keeper.
Very moist and succulent! I added a few red potatoes during roasting to thicken up the gravy...
Unbelievably delicious, fork tender. I added potatoes. Enough juices to make gravy, if desired
I added 3 potatoes before baking. Delicious!
This was fabulous, I will make this again and I had leftovers which was even better.
Absolutely delicious and I added green bell peppers

I made this for our Easter Dinner--loved, loved, loved it, as did my husband. Our roast was more like 2-1/2 pounds, as it was just for the 2 of us sheltering in place during Covid-19, but I followed the recipe as per the size of meat indicated. Really tasty and tender. Served it with asparagus and roasted red potatoes. Definitely adding it to our favorites for holiday meals! Hopefully, will be sharing with more next time!
Nowhere near enough carrots, celery and onions. I would double or triple the amounts.

Great recipe - no changes - baked 3+ hours, it wasn't ready at 2 1/2. Great comfort food. Served it with mashed red skin potatoes. Yummy. I want to try the horseradish mashed potatoes next time. Had just enough left over for soup.
Super easy recipe! I added 2 diced sweet potatoes in the pot for the last 30 minutes of cooking and it was so good! Didn't need mashed potatoes. Definitely a keeper!

Wow... I was skeptical at first because this isn't how Grandma used to make it... boy, was I wrong. The simplicity of this makes it even more incredible how well the roast turned out. I eyeballed the veggies, adding a little extra of each. Crushed two cloves of garlic and sweated it off with the veggies. A dash of thyme and rosemary and threw a 3lbs roast in the oven for 3 hours. It came our moist, with a crispy crust (think the best part of ordering carnitas). Served on top of some creamy mash potatoes with the veggies and we dug in. If you're looking for the ultimate quarantine meal... this is it. Throw it together, take a bike ride with the kids, play a little baseball in the backyard and in 3 hours... dinner is served!
I didn't have any marjoram; I used Trader Joes 21 Season Salute. It is wonderful. I put it in a Reynolds bag and cooked it in a clay baker. This will be a goe-to recipe for me.
Excellent! Did not make any changes.

It is delicious!!! I make this all of the time. I cook mine in the oven even longer ~3.5 hours and you get more carmelization and tenderness. It’s by far the best pot roast recipe and I think the Le Creuset Dutch oven makes all of the difference. I’ve also tried pot roast recipes in the instant pot and slow cooker, but a Dutch oven is what makes it magic.

Absolutely DELICIOUS! I’ve never had success with pot roast. This recipe is on point! Only thing I did differently was add about one cup of diced butternut squash to the onion, celery & carrot. And three stems of fresh rosemary!
The meat was very good. My husband and I didn't care for the vegetables all chopped up - they came out very mushy.

This was absolutely delicious! The texture and flavor were better than my usual crockpot roasts. I used a cake pan with foil for baking because I don’t have a Dutch oven. The veggies were super soft but not broken down so I just used my potato masher, made the best gravy like sauce! Will definitely be making this again and again.
We loved it. Best pot roast I've ever had. And easy. Thanks, Chef John!

This was the best, moist, flavorful pot roast. The carrots, onions and celery flavor the meat so good. I added garlic powder, a bit of beef stock and lemon pepper. Then, I made gravy out of the juice. Excellent

This was decent. I tried to make it according to the recipe. The only difference was that I used fresh rosemary. I didn’t love how soft the veggies were, but my son did eat the celery, so something must have gone well! While some were happy with it, I didn’t love it and will continue searching for a pot roast recipe that I love.
I made this exactly as recipe states 3 times an each time it was delicious! It's true. It's come out great every time!

This is the best pot roast I have ever made. I usually do a crock pot roast, but didn't have the time today. I looked this up and made just as written, but I used a large london broil instead of a chuck roast, and I added a can of condensed tomato soup on top before I roasted it. It makes the gravy really thick and tangy.
made this tonight and family loved it!! Forgot to buy rosemary so made it without and still came out great and so tender!!!

I Made this for the first time with Chuck Steaks. Instead of Carrots, I used Potatoes, and My Discriminating Husband LOVED IT! He proposed to me again after 20 years of marriage. Have fun with this recipe. The key to a tender roast is the pre-searing (like Lamb). It seals in the flavor and juices in a way I have never experienced...I'm making a Chuck Roast tonight...

Love it! And so did everyone else. The meat is tender while the simple seasoning appeals to every person at the table.
My contribution was diced celery and it melded beautifully with whole carrots and whole Yukon gold potatoes. The only thing that I would change is adding the carrots about halfway through. Since I bake mine for five hours or so the veggies can soften to a nonexistence. Still delicious and a huge success!

My husband and I have made this twice now. Absolutely the best and only way to have pot roast! Until now I have never really loved pot roast. Chef John never disappoints! I now love pot roast! How can such simple ingredients equal such incredible flavor! Thanks again Chef John! You are my favorite! Ever!!
This is the way to make it. The only variation I make is to leave the vegetables whole, including the onion. Absolutely, no liquid is needed.

Throw out the onion soup mix and make this pot roast exactly as written! This is another Chef John recipe that is simple and doesn’t disappoint. The wife wanted to know what seasoning was used...she couldn’t believe it was just salt, pepper and rosemary ( and butter ??). I like rosemary, but even if you don’t it’s subtle in this pot roast. The vegetables do cook down significantly and are very soft. However they are delicious. Next time I may increase the veggies and chop instead of dice. I did add peeled red potatoes for the last 90 minutes of cooking and they turned out perfect. This is your grandma’s Sunday pot roast, delicious and easy to make!

My son and family came to Sunday dinner and I made this roast. It was quick to prepare and so much better than previous Dutch oven method. Of course at $8+ per # that meat should be tender. I’ll make this again.
